subtitle: Have a skilled birth attendant
title: How to have a safe birth
content:
Created by BabyCenter

It is safest, and recommended, to give birth in a health facility, where there is help if there are problems.

You should give birth in a health facility, where it is safe for you and your baby. If your baby comes too quickly, so you cannot get to a health facility in time, here is how to have a safe birth.

•	Try to have a skilled birth attendant with you. She will help you to give birth safely and she will do what is necessary if there is a problem.

•	Make sure you have the health worker’s phone number so you can call her in an emergency. Make sure you have enough airtime on your phone. 

•	Have a plan for getting to the health facility quickly. Get taxi, (or boda boda) numbers ready, or the number of a trusted friend who has a car, or maybe the number for an ambulance.

•	Make sure your family knows how to contact the birth attendant when it is time. 

•	Make sure you have a birth kit ready. Your birth attendant may bring a birth kit. It will contain a plastic sheet, gloves, clean string and tools for cutting your baby's cord. All these items are important for a clean, safe birth. 

•	If you cannot get a birth kit, buy 7 pairs of gloves, 2 plastic sheets, at least 4 baby’s cloths, a sterile razor blade, 2 clean strings, a roll of cotton wool, a roll of gauze and pieces of cotton cloth for mother (Lesu)

•	Prepare the pieces of cloth (Lesu) to use early, wash iron and fold them ready for birth.

•	Your attendant must wash her hands and you must wash between your legs. Get plenty of clean, boiled water and soap ready.
